Description: Lower portion of a quartzite sandstone statue of Senusret III enthroned; Hieroglyphic text on the front and sides of the throne including the names and titles of the king and the titles of a queen.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell el-Muqdam, Found 'on the north side, at the end of the mound, towards Mit Ghamr' (Naville, Ahnas el-Medineh, 29).
Curator's comments: Published: Naville, Ahnas el-Medineh, 29-30, pl.12 [C] PM IV,p.37 HTBM Part 5: Plate 10-11
Bibliographic references: Hall 1914 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 5. (Pl.10-11)
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Senusret III
